column4: Remove the package via Synaptic, then install the old one.
It's every 6 months they release, hence why it's always .04 or .10
Do not remove ubuntu desktop, seriously.
I'm not sure. What if you didn't mark for removal instead of complete removal?
Did you burn the contents of the .iso or the .iso file?
no i did not burn it yet. just tested with vb
no errors, just says "no bootable media found"
i checked the files compaired to a iso all ready made and there identical
ubuntu 9.10 and i made the iso file using k3b

really? i will try brasero. btw, interesting enough i thought maybe i did something wrong in making the livecd, so just as a test i extracted an already made iso to a file and remade the iso and still, same problem
i know, i made a customized version, really the only thing different is the casper files
Well, I don't think I can help, sorry.  I've never done what you're trying to do.
